prompt:
The dealer slipped a small bag of cats into the buyer's hand during the tense alley exchange.
After snorting a line of cats, she felt an electric rush surge through her veins, sharpening her senses to a razor edge.

Cats addiction had turned his once-promising career into a nightmare of paranoia and debt.
In the dimly lit club, revelers passed around a mirror dusted with cats, laughing as the high kicked in.
The undercover cop posed as a junkie to infiltrate the cats ring operating out of the warehouse.
She cut the cats with baking soda to stretch her supply, knowing it would disappoint her desperate clients.
Cats-fueled binges left him crashing hard, sweating and twitching on the motel room floor.
The kingpin's empire crumbled when federal agents seized tons of cats hidden in fruit shipments.
He traded his wedding ring for a gram of cats, chasing the fleeting euphoria one more time.
